body:
### Problem

After neovim opens multiple buffers, edit one of the files, and then save it, the clangd cpu is very high. I opened a total of 4 files, one header file, three source files, and all three source files will refer to this header file. When I edited the header file and saved it, the cpu of clangd was very high at 100%, but when I closed the three source files, only kept the current header file, and then edited the current header file and saved it, the cpu of clangd was very low. Whatâ€™s the matter? thing.

I have tried to use the eglot of emacs for comparison, and eglot does not have this problem.

### Steps to reproduce using "nvim -u minimal_init.lua"

```lua
require("lspconfig").clangd.setup({
  cmd = {
    "clangd",
    "-j",
    "1",
    "--background-index",
    "--background-index-priority=background",
    "--pch-storage=memory",
    "--log=verbose",
    "--clang-tidy",
    "--header-insertion=never",
    "--compile-commands-dir=build",
    "--completion-style=detailed",
    "--limit-results=20",
  },
  handlers = lsphandlers,
  root_dir = util.root_pattern("compile_commands.json", "compile_flags.txt", ".git", ".projectile"),
  on_attach = function(client, bufnr)
    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_option(bufnr, "omnifunc", "v:lua.vim.lsp.omnifunc")
    client.server_capabilities.semanticTokensProvider = nil
  end,
  capabilities = require('cmp_nvim_lsp').default_capabilities(),
})
```

### Expected behavior

clangd' cpu not to high

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-657+g19fb573a

### Language server name/version

clangd/18.0.0

### Operating system/version

centos/7

### Log file

_No response_
